statement.tex: \\ \text{Which of the following sets of substitutions}\\ \text{will make it easier to calculate the integral?}
\\ \text{Has the integral been calculated correctly}\\ \text{below in terms of x?}

reason.tex: \text{When substituting, you ideally want to pick a}\\ t = f(x) \text{ such that only }dt = f'(x)\text{ is in the } \\ \text{numerator and something with just }t\text{ is in }\\ \text{the denominator.}
\text{Use }\int\dfrac{dt}{\sqrt{t^2 + b^2}} = \log\left| t + \sqrt{t^2 + b^2}\right| + C. \\ \text{And don't forget, } t = x^3 \text{ and } b = a^3.
